title: More Monkey Pox Cases Likely To Hit Europe Soon, Says WHO
content: The World Health Organization said more imported Clade 1 mpox cases were likely to be confirmed in Europe soon, after Sweden on Thursday announced the first such case outside Africa.
summary: The World Health Organization said more imported Clade 1 mpox cases were likely to be confirmed in Europe soon, after Sweden on Thursday announced the first such case outside Africa.

title: Israel To Build New Jewish Settlement Between Jerusalem, West Bank: Report
content: Israel is to build the first West Bank settlement since 2017, announced the Israeli Civil Administration, the country's governing body that operates in the West Bank, local media reported.
summary: Israel is to build the first West Bank settlement since 2017, announced the Israeli Civil Administration, the country's governing body that operates in the West Bank, local media reported.

title: "Took Advantage Of His Addiction": 5 Charged Over Matthew Perry's Death
content: US prosecutors said Thursday they have charged five people, including two doctors, over the death of "Friends" star Matthew Perry, who died at his Los Angeles home last year after years of struggling with addiction.
summary: US prosecutors said Thursday they have charged five people, including two doctors, over the death of "Friends" star Matthew Perry, who died at his Los Angeles home last year after years of struggling with addiction.

title: Kim Dotcom To Be Extradited From New Zealand After 12-Year Fight With US
content: Kim Dotcom, who is facing criminal charges relating to the defunct file-sharing website Megaupload, will be extradited to the United States from New Zealand, the New Zealand justice minister said on Thursday.
summary: Kim Dotcom, who is facing criminal charges relating to the defunct file-sharing website Megaupload, will be extradited to the United States from New Zealand, the New Zealand justice minister said on Thursday.

title: Sweden Confirms 1st Case Of "More Grave" Type Of Monkey Pox Virus
content: Sweden said on Thursday it had confirmed a first case of mpox, a viral infection that spreads through close contact.
summary: Sweden said on Thursday it had confirmed a first case of mpox, a viral infection that spreads through close contact.

title: 1 Arrested In Connection To "Friends" Actor Matthew Perry's Death: Report
content: At least one person has been arrested in connection with the ketamine overdose death last year of "Friends" actor Matthew Perry, US media reported Thursday.
summary: At least one person has been arrested in connection with the ketamine overdose death last year of "Friends" actor Matthew Perry, US media reported Thursday.

title: Monkeypox Virus Killed 548 People In This Nation Since Start Of 2024
content: An mpox outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo has killed 548 people since the start of the year, with all provinces affected by the virus, the health minister said on Thursday in a statement.
summary: An mpox outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo has killed 548 people since the start of the year, with all provinces affected by the virus, the health minister said on Thursday in a statement.

title: This US City Has Been Declared America's Least Desirable, Survey Finds
content: A new poll conducted by real estate company Clever has found Washington DC to be the least desirable city in America.
summary: A new poll conducted by real estate company Clever has found Washington DC to be the least desirable city in America.

title: Bangladesh Tribunal Begins 'Genocide' Probe Against Sheikh Hasina, 9 Others
content: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has started an investigation against former PM Sheikh Hasina and nine others on charges of genocide and crimes against humanity that took place from July 15 to August 5 during the students' mass movement.
summary: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has started an investigation against former PM Sheikh Hasina and nine others on charges of genocide and crimes against humanity that took place from July 15 to August 5 during the students' mass movement.

title: Navalny's Wife Rejects Finding He Died From "Combination Of Illnesses"
content: The wife of late Russian dissident Alexei Navalny said on Thursday that investigators had told her his death in an Arctic prison colony in February was caused by a "combination of diseases" - a finding she rejected as preposterous.
summary: The wife of late Russian dissident Alexei Navalny said on Thursday that investigators had told her his death in an Arctic prison colony in February was caused by a "combination of diseases" - a finding she rejected as preposterous.

title: Gaza Ceasefire Talks Begin In Qatar, Israel Spy Chief To Attend
content: A new round of Gaza ceasefire talks was underway in the Qatari capital Doha on Thursday afternoon, an offical briefed on the meeting told Reuters.
summary: A new round of Gaza ceasefire talks was underway in the Qatari capital Doha on Thursday afternoon, an offical briefed on the meeting told Reuters.

title: "Sending A Team...": UN's 1st Fact-Finding Mission To Bangladesh Since 1971
content: A team of UN experts will visit Bangladesh next week to investigate the killings of the protesters ahead of and in the aftermath of Sheikh Hasina's resignation as the prime minister last week, it was announced on Thursday.
summary: A team of UN experts will visit Bangladesh next week to investigate the killings of the protesters ahead of and in the aftermath of Sheikh Hasina's resignation as the prime minister last week, it was announced on Thursday.

title: 8-Year-Old Girl In US Fights Off Armed Robber With Baseball Bat
content: An 8-year-old girl in the US recently managed to thwart a robbery at her father's liquor store after she repeatedly beat the man with a baseball bat.
summary: An 8-year-old girl in the US recently managed to thwart a robbery at her father's liquor store after she repeatedly beat the man with a baseball bat.

title: Musk Has A Favourite Interview Question That Experts Say Can Catch Liars
content: A job interview question has been found to have the potential to catch liars and billionaire Elon Musk has been using it.
summary: A job interview question has been found to have the potential to catch liars and billionaire Elon Musk has been using it.

title: Over 40,000 Killed In Gaza Amid Raging War, Says Hamas Health Ministry
content: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said on Thursday that the death toll has crossed 40,000 in the more than 10-month war between Israel and Palestinian operatives.
summary: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said on Thursday that the death toll has crossed 40,000 in the more than 10-month war between Israel and Palestinian operatives.

title: "Building Was Swaying": Taiwan Hit By 5.4 Magnitude Earthquake
content: A 5.4 magnitude earthquake hit northeastern Taiwan on Thursday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said, with the tremor shaking buildings in Taipei but causing no major damage.
summary: A 5.4 magnitude earthquake hit northeastern Taiwan on Thursday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said, with the tremor shaking buildings in Taipei but causing no major damage.

title: "Guilty Of High Treason": Russia Jails US-Origin Ballet Dancer For 12 Years
content: US-Russian citizen Ksenia Karelina was sentenced to 12 years in prison for "treason" by a Russian court on Thursday, after allegedly donating a little over $50 to a pro-Ukraine charity.
summary: US-Russian citizen Ksenia Karelina was sentenced to 12 years in prison for "treason" by a Russian court on Thursday, after allegedly donating a little over $50 to a pro-Ukraine charity.

title: Sri Lanka Has 39 Presidential Candidates This Time, But No Woman Among Them
content: A total of 39 candidates, including three minority Tamils and two Buddhist monks, are in the fray for next month's presidential election in Sri Lanka, the election commission announced here on Thursday.
summary: A total of 39 candidates, including three minority Tamils and two Buddhist monks, are in the fray for next month's presidential election in Sri Lanka, the election commission announced here on Thursday.

title: Trump Reveals Why He Sounded Like He Had A Lisp During Musk Interview
content: "Unfortunately, because of the complexity of modern-day equipment, and cellphone technology, my voice was, in certain areas, somewhat different and strange," he said.
summary: "Unfortunately, because of the complexity of modern-day equipment, and cellphone technology, my voice was, in certain areas, somewhat different and strange," he said.

title: Netanyahu Denies Reports Of Speaking To Trump Over Gaza Ceasefire
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu denied on Thursday a report that he had spoken the previous day with Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump about Gaza ceasefire and hostage release talks.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu denied on Thursday a report that he had spoken the previous day with Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump about Gaza ceasefire and hostage release talks.
